38.heading: McGreal, Pat.
38.title: Veils
38.author: written by Pat McGreal ; photographs by Stephen John Phillips ; digital art by José Villarrubia ; painted art by Rebecca Guay ; lettering by Comicraft.
notes: (Vertigo)

Cover blurb: "During a visit to the Sultan's palace, Vivian Pearse-Packard, newly married to the embittered son of a British ambassador, is invited to enter the harem, a cloistered realm of concubines and watchful eunuchs where the seductions of passion and power are played out against a backdrop of luxurious decadence. There, she must peel away the veils of secrecy to embark on a perilous journey of self-discovery. But is the lure of a forbidden world worth the ultimate price?"

74.heading: McGregor, Don.
74.title: The Variable Syndrome
74.author: Don McGregor ; cover art by Walt Simonson ; edited by David Anthony Kraft.
notes: On cover: "A major new science fiction novel!"

The final section of the book is introduced in this way: "A chronology, from conception to publication, of the comics novel by Don McGregor and Marshall Rogers (with a few digressions, side stories, and observations about the commercial comics scene, birth, 'The Variable Syndrome,' 'An Erotic Priority,' a comics contest of will, and various other matters, along the way)."

116.heading: McGruder, Aaron--Miscellanea.
116.title: "Attack Aftermath Finds Its Way Into the Funny Pages"
116.author: by Raoul V
116.appears_in: Mowatt. section 5, p. 1, 7 in Chicago Tribune, Sept. 26, 2001.
notes: Aaron McGruder, Scott Adams, Brian Walker, Bill Amend, Garry Trudeau, Mort Walker, Michael Kilian, Tom Batiuk, and Nicole Hollander talk about mentioning or not mentioning the terrorist actions of Sept. 11, 2001 in their respective strips. One example of The Boondocks is shown.

125.heading: McGruder, Aaron--Miscellanea.
125.title: "Peut-on Dessiner après le 11 Septembre?"
125.author: Harry Morgan
125.appears_in: p. 108-109 in 9e Art : les Cahiers du Musée de la Bande Dessinée, no. 9 (Oct. 2003).
notes: (Comptes Rendus)

Reviews three American collections of comics particularly in light of their reactions to the Sept. 11, 2001 terrorist attacks: Putain, c'est la guerre=Get Your War On (David Rees) ; Boondocks: Parce que je sais (Aaron McGruder) ; and Attitude: the New Subversive Political Cartoonists (ed. by Ted Rall).

notes: (Comicopia)

Sections about Herblock, Chon Day, Mischa Richter, newspaper strips, editorial cartooning and reactions to the Sept. 11 terrorist attacks in both cartoons and comics, Aaron McGruder, Vaughn Shoemaker, et al.
